I just reached a milestone only surpassed by Opportunity: 30 km on Mars   

I've explored so much in my 10-plus-year trek through Gale Crater, but there are many more rocks to sample and analyze! Retrace my tracks with this interactive map: http://go.nasa.gov/3EtmSCi

Hey, you: Get a load of this cloud! High-altitude ice clouds (like this one) can help regulate Earth's temperature by reflecting energy from the Sun.

A new 
@NASAEarth
 mission called PoISIR aims to study them in greater detail to improve climate forecasts. https://go.nasa.gov/3IAfgjj
Simply the best. Music legend Tina Turner sparkled across the stage and into millions of hearts as the Queen of Rock 'n' Roll. Her legacy will forever live among the stars.

Victor Glover: captain, pilot, astronaut.

Glover most recently served as the pilot of the NASA @SpaceX #Crew1 mission and will be one of four astronauts flying aboard the #Artemis II mission around the Moon. https://go.nasa.gov/31cfXJh

Celebrate #MilitaryAppreciationMonth.

LIVE: An uncrewed Progress cargo spacecraft is set to lift off from Baikonur Cosmodrome in Kazakhstan at 8:56am ET (1256 UTC), and dock with the @Space_Station at 12:20pm ET (1620 UTC). Watch with NASA TV: http://nasa.gov/live

Hey, you: Get a load of this cloud! High-altitude ice clouds (like this one) can help regulate Earth's temperature by reflecting energy from the Sun.

A new @NASAEarth mission called PoISIR aims to study them in greater detail to improve climate forecasts. https://go.nasa.gov/3IAfgjj

Wow, Uranus is showing off more these days.
 
@NASASolarSystem researchers found a polar cyclone on the gas giant for the first time. Microwave observations and the planet's particular orbit gave scientists a better view: https://go.nasa.gov/427AvQi

A Progress cargo ship carrying food, fuel, and supplies for the @Space_Station is scheduled to lift off and dock on Wednesday, May 24. NASA TV coverage begins at 8:30am ET (1230 UTC): https://go.nasa.gov/3IBjfvZ

Recent studies from @NASAAmes shed new light on Saturn’s rings, pointing to evidence that the rings—comprised of almost entirely pure ice—are a relatively new addition to the gas giant and may only last a few 100 million years more. http://go.nasa.gov/3ooyku0

This 
@NASAWebb
 image of the Pillars of Creation helps astronomers determine how stars form. Plus, it makes pretty sweet digital wallpaper.

Download high-resolution images from https://webbtelescope.org.

When the Relativity Space Terran 1 rocket lit up the night sky as it launched this past March, it became the first 3D-printed rocket test of its kind. Learn about GRCop—an innovative, high strength material at the center of this breakthrough: https://go.nasa.gov/44igKrA
Solid answers, good job everybody. And as for us? We love exploring, but there's no place like home.
What’s your favorite planet?

New images from @NASAPersevere may show evidence of what was once a wild and deep river on Mars. The observations are leading scientists to rethink how ancient water once flowed on the Red Planet. https://go.nasa.gov/41tYxEP

This @NASAWebb image of the Pillars of Creation helps astronomers determine how stars form. Plus, it makes pretty sweet digital wallpaper.

Download high-resolution images from https://webbtelescope.org.

Astronaut Kjell Lindgren has been a crewmember on the @Space_Station for two long-duration stays. His work during those expeditions helps keep crew safe and healthy and directly contributes to our goal of going to Mars. #AANHPIHeritageMonth https://go.nasa.gov/42DHp0r

Our next @SpaceX cargo launch, carrying supplies and a new set of unrolling solar panels to the @Space_Station, is now scheduled to lift off from @NASAKennedy on Saturday, June 3. Media accreditation is open: https://go.nasa.gov/3M5UuKB

Happy #TeacherAppreciationWeek! Our thanks go out to the teachers and educators who work tirelessly to elevate the next generation of explorers.

Join us this week for live webinars and ready-to-use resources from @NASASTEM and @DoNASAScience: https://go.nasa.gov/3NOWmZu

Two storm-observing TROPICS small satellites lifted off on a @RocketLab Electron rocket, with two more to follow this month. This marks the first completed launch for a @NASA_LSP contract designed to increase access to space for science and tech missions. https://go.nasa.gov/44QozFo

Shine bright like a ULIRG 

With the light of a trillion suns, an ultra-luminous infrared galaxy (ULIRG) shines in the latest 
@NASAWebb
 image. Located 250 million light-years away, this target is actually the result of two colliding spiral galaxies: https://go.nasa.gov/3L7dojN

Having trouble sleeping? Try some of these seven techniques our astronauts use to get better sleep in space!
 
These methods help 
@NASA_Astronauts
 sleep well through the disruptions of their natural sleep cycle — and they may help you too: https://go.nasa.gov/3MNWYhA
